Projects About Status

About

KikuAI Lab is a laboratory for building autonomous AI micro-products. We believe in the power of focused, single-purpose tools that solve real problems. Our philosophy is simple: one function, one product. Each service we build does one thing exceptionally well, without the bloat of trying to be everything to everyone. This approach allows us to iterate quickly, maintain high quality, and deliver value faster.

Autonomy is at the core of everything we build. Our products are self-contained services that run independently, with minimal dependencies and clear interfaces. This makes them reliable, scalable, and easy to integrate into existing workflows. We don't build monolithic platforms—we build focused tools that work together when needed, but stand alone when they don't.

We're market-first, not tech-first. Every product starts with a real problem that needs solving, not a cool technology looking for a use case. We focus on the Western market, where users value simplicity, reliability, and clear value propositions. Our distribution strategy relies on passive channels—SEO, word-of-mouth, and organic discovery—rather than aggressive marketing. This ensures our work has immediate value and clear purpose.

Minimalism and accessibility guide our design decisions. We build products that are easy to understand, easy to use, and accessible to everyone. No unnecessary complexity, no hidden features, no learning curve. If a feature doesn't directly solve the problem, it doesn't belong. This commitment to simplicity makes our products more reliable, more maintainable, and more valuable to users.

Principles

  • → One function, one product — Each service solves exactly one problem, exceptionally well
  • → Autonomous by design — Self-contained services with minimal dependencies and clear interfaces
  • → Market-first approach — Start with real problems, not cool technologies
  • → Passive distribution — Rely on SEO, word-of-mouth, and organic discovery
  • → Western market focus — Build for users who value simplicity and reliability
  • → Minimalism — No unnecessary complexity, no hidden features, no learning curve
  • → Accessibility — Products that are easy to understand, use, and accessible to everyone
  • → Open source — Transparent, auditable, and community-driven development
